questions.question: Considering the textual content's overall arrangement, what is the primary language used for the label's main ingredient declaration?
What secondary language is employed for the product's ingredient listing, positioned beneath the primary language?

In terms of visual layout, describe the orientation of the textual content that communicates the ingredients of the product.
Examining the visual characteristics, determine the textual case of the word 'INGREDIENTS' in both English and French.
Disregarding any contextual knowledge, what is the color of the text detailing the product's constituent components?
Based solely on the visual presentation, what is the background color of the area where the ingredients are listed?
Considering the style of the text, describe the visual weight of the word 'INGREDIENTS' in relation to the ingredient list.
Analyzing the label's composition, describe the relative position of the English ingredient list compared to its French counterpart.
Considering only what is visually apparent, what punctuation mark separates the word 'INGREDIENTS' from the list of ingredients?
